name: Chocolate Zucchini Muffins
description: Rich, moist, and chocolatey, these vegan Chocolate Zucchini Muffins are the best way to use up all of your extra zucchini. Freezer friendly and easy to make gluten and oil free!
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup neutral flavored oil (such as canola, grapeseed, melted coconut)
1 cup lightly packed grated zucchini, drained of excess water (about 1 medium zucchini)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a standard muffin pan with liners and spray them lightly with oil so the muffins don't stick to the liners.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a standard muffin pan with liners and spray them lightly with oil so the muffins don't stick to the liners.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, add the flour, cocoa, baking powder and salt. Whisk well to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, add the flour, cocoa, baking powder and salt. Whisk well to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: In another medium sized bowl, whisk together the soy milk, oil, ground flaxseeds and sugar until smooth. Lightly squeeze excess water out of the grated zucchini, then stir it into the wet ingredients.
recipeInstructions.name: In another medium sized bowl, whisk together the soy milk, oil, ground flaxseeds and sugar until smooth. Lightly squeeze excess water out of the grated zucchini, then stir it into the wet ingredients.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the wet mixture to the bowl with the dry ingredients and stir until just combined, being careful not to over mix.  Fold in the chocolate chips, saving some for the tops.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the wet mixture to the bowl with the dry ingredients and stir until just combined, being careful not to over mix.  Fold in the chocolate chips, saving some for the tops.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide the batter among the muffin cups, filling about 3/4 of the way full. Sprinkle with extra chocolate chips, if desired. Bake for 20-23 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide the batter among the muffin cups, filling about 3/4 of the way full. Sprinkle with extra chocolate chips, if desired. Bake for 20-23 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Cool in the pan for about 5 minutes, then carefully transfer to a cooling rack. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Cool in the pan for about 5 minutes, then carefully transfer to a cooling rack. Enjoy!

recipeInstructions.text: Muffins will keep for up to 3 days in an airtight container at room temperature, or up to 5 days in the refrigerator. They also freeze well.
recipeInstructions.name: Muffins will keep for up to 3 days in an airtight container at room temperature, or up to 5 days in the refrigerator. They also freeze well.
